intro: Mollinedia pubescens, commonly known as the hairy mollinedia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Mollinedia pubescens is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and wetlands.
